DataElement.preferredName: Person Histologic Ovarian Neoplasm Fallopian Tube Neoplasm Confirmed Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has histologically confirmed ovarian cancer (malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm involving the ovary) or malignant neoplasm affecting the fallopian tube as criteria required to to be eligible to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Histologic Ovarian Neoplasm Fallopian Tube Neoplasm Confirmed Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having histologically confirmed ovarian cancer (malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm involving the ovary) or malignant neoplasm affecting the fallopian tube as criteria required to to be eligible to participate in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Histologic Ovarian Neoplasm Fallopian Tube Neoplasm Confirmed Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to histology.:A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm involving the ovary.:A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting the fallopian tube. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papilloma, adenofibroma, and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, carcinosarcoma, and adenosarcoma.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
A benign, borderline, or malignant neoplasm involving the ovary.

A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting the fallopian tube. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papilloma, adenofibroma, and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, carcinosarcoma, and adenosarcoma.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have histolo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube or primary peritoneal cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a histologic diagnosis of mucinous adenocarcinoma of the ovary or Fallopian tube

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologic diagnosis of epithelial ovarian carcinoma, peritoneal primary or fallopian tube carcinoma which is now recurrent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a current diagnosis of borderline epithelial ovarian tumor (formerly tumors of low malignant potential)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologic diagnosis of epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal carcinoma which is now recurrent or persistent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have recurrent or persistent epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal carcinoma with documented disease progression (disease not amenable to curative therapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have institutional confirmation of Mullerian epithelial adenocarcinoma on core biopsy (not cytology or fine needle aspiration) or laparoscopic biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have recurrent ovarian cancer?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
